page.title: 03CADLAND HOUSE.
page.content: Some 75% of the land in our project area is owned by the Drummond family. Mr. Maldwin Drummond lives at Cadland House, roughly midway between Lepe and Calshot, overlooking the Solent and the Isle of Wight. The Drummond family came to this area in{1772.} The first Cadland House was built overlooking Southampton Water where the Esso Refinery now stands. It was designed by Henry Holland and its Park and grounds were planned by Capability Brown. The present Cadland House was originally a fishing cottage. It has an interesting history including being burned down and rebuilt twice. The existing building was completed in {1935. }After the{2nd World War}when Esso purchased and pulled down the original house, the fishing cottage inherited the name Cadland House.
